results.title: Unemployment: voices from the line
results.creator_credit: Pierre Lasry, Peter Katadotis, Mark Zannis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film about the effects of unemployment on the lives of individuals and their families. It exposes the harsh realities of unemployment and graphically depicts situations that contradict the notion that unemployment insurance takes care of the problems. The film illustrates that most unemployed persons prefer to work and that the real cost of unemployment is human suffering. Unemployment: Voices from the Line is a powerful and disturbing account of a national tragedy that, until now, has been viewed solely in economic terms.

results.title: Unemployment and money: the principles involved
results.brief_description: A description and discussion of the principles which cause a recurrence of unemployment. Describes in detail the circulation of money and the place of banks in the monetary system.
results.description: A description and discussion of the principles which cause a recurrence of unemployment. Describes in detail the circulation of money and the place of banks in the monetary system.

results.title: Une Vie = a Life
results.brief_description:
Jeanne Dandieu lives with her parents and Rosalie, the maid, in a Normandy mansion. She is rescued from drowning by Julien de la Mare. For Jeanne, it is love at first sight. She introduces him to her parents. A few months later they are engaged to be married. This hurry starts rumours in the village that Julien is only marrying to pay off his debts. Their relationship seems a happy one until the day Jeanne’s parents leave the mansion. Jeanne discovers that her husband is having an affair with Rosalie and that she is pregnant. Jeanne feigns forgiveness, but plans in secret to take her revenge.

Credits: Producers, Annie Dorfmann ; director, Alexandre Astruc ; writers, Roland Laudenbach, Alexandre Astruc ; photography, Claude Renoir ; music, Roman Vlad ; costumes, Mayo, Lucilla.
Cast: Maria Schell, Christian Marquand, Antonella Lualdi, Ivan Desny, Pascale Petit, Marie-Helene Daste, Louis Arbessier, Andree Tainsy, Gerard Darrieu.

results.title: Une Si Jolie Petite Plage = Such a Pretty Little Beach
results.brief_description:
Pierre registers at a dismal hotel in a desolate seaside resort in Normandy. He had worked there as a kitchen hand some years before and run off with a famous singer, who has just been found dead. He is supected by a mysterious fellow guest of having committed a crime of passion. Instead of finding peace in the village were he grew up, Pierre is driven to desparation by the grotesque pettiness of the local townsfolk, the duplicity of friends and so-called loved ones and the relentlessly rotten weather.

Credits: Producer, Emile Darbon ; director, Yves Allegret ; writer, Jacques Sigurd ; photography, Henri Alekan ; music, Maurice Thiriet.
Cast: Madeleine Robinson, Gerard Philippe, Jane Marken, Jean Servais, Julien Carette, Mona Dol, Andre Valmy.

results.title: Une Semaine de Vacances = a Week's Vacation
results.brief_description:
A Lyons schoolteacher in her early thirties suffers from severe depression as a result of a crisis of faith in her work and unresolved differences in her relationship whith her lover. On doctor’s orders she take a week off during which she visits her parents and has several encounters, notably with the father of one of her pupils. Placed specifically in time - Winter, 1980 - and place - Lyons, its landscape filmed with loving detail - this is a portrait of a woman trying to find sense and direction in her life.

Credits: Director, Bertrand Tavernier ; writers, Bertrand Tavernier, Marie-Francoise Hans, Colo Tavernier ; photography, Pierre William Glenn ; music, Pierre Papadiamandis.
Cast: Nathalie Baye, Gerard Lanvin, Michel Galabru, Philippe Noiret.

results.title: Une Semaine de bonte, ou, Les sept elements capitaux
results.creator_credit: Jean Desvilles and Les Productions Tanit
results.brief_description: Pictures the work of Max Ernst in which he uses Victorian engravings to animate a Gothic tale of a world where only the inconceivable represents the norm. Narrated in English.

results.title: Une Partie de Campagne = a Day in the Country
results.brief_description:
In this bitter-sweet Maupassant vignette set in 1860, a Parisian merchant takes his family for a day in the country. The picnic and a seduction form the centre of the tale. Renoir replaces Maupassant’s detached observation with a celebration of nature. While an impressionistic sense of transcience is perfectly captured, it is Renoir’s clear perception of character aided by Kosma’s music that generates the film’s depth of feeling.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, writer, Jean Renoir ; photography, Claude Renoir, Jean Bourgoin ; assistants, Luchino Visconti, Jacques Becker, Henri Cartier-Bresson ; music, Joseph Kosma ; editor, Marguerite Renoir.
Cast: Sylvia Bataille, Georges Darnoux, Jeanne Marken, Gabriello, .

results.title: Une Parisienne
results.creator_credit: Michael Boisrand, Francis Cosne, Rizzoli Film, Filmsonor, Cinetel and Les Films Ariane
results.brief_description: Brigitte Laurier is the beautiful daughter of the French Premier. When she is found, quite innocently, in bed with Michel, the Premier’s principal secretary, a quick marriage seems to be the only solution to save appearances. In this lighthearted French comedy, a royal flirtation may not be the only thing in the way of married bliss. Stars Charles Boyer and Brigitte Bardot. Dubbed into English

results.title: Une Page D'amour = a Moment of Love (TV Version)
results.brief_description:
Helene has an affair with the doctor who is taking care of her daughter, Jeanne. Filled with jealousy, Jeanne lets herself die, thus bringing an end to ‘a moment of love’.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Elie Chouraqui ; writers, Elie Chouraqui, Nico Papatakis.
Cast: Anouk Aimee, Bruno Cremer.

results.title: Une job steady - un bon boss
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren, Jean-V. Dufresne and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Ask any French Canadian, who tells the funniest stories and he’ll say with a chuckle Yvon Deschamps. Now big box office, Deschamps grew up in Montreal’s inner city, where, he says, mothers didn’t speak, they just hit. Here he is, on and off stage, quipping, haranguing with irreverent wit-the very embodiment of Quebec humour and slant on life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian McLaren, Jean-V. Dufresne and National Film Board of Canada
